commented_code:
```
 cd my-turborepo
-pnpm build
+
+# With [global `turbo`](https://turborepo.com/docs/getting-started/installation#global-installation) installed (recommended)
+turbo build
+
+# Without [global `turbo`](https://turborepo.com/docs/getting-started/installation#global-installation) installed
+npx turbo build
+yarn dlx turbo build
+pnpm exec turbo build
+```
+
+You can build a specific package by using a [filter](https://turborepo.com/docs/crafting-your-repository/running-tasks#using-filters):
+
+```
+# With [global `turbo`](https://turborepo.com/docs/getting-started/installation#global-installation) installed (recommended)
+turbo build --filter=docs
+
+# Without [global `turbo`](https://turborepo.com/docs/getting-started/installation#global-installation) installed

commented_code:
Note: this is not through turbo, so you'll have to build turbo yourself first.
 
+- Updating Integration Tests
+
+  ```
+  pnpm -- turbo run build --filter=cli
+  pnpm test:interactive -F turborepo-tests-integration

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -96,6 +96,19 @@ Then from the root directory, you can run:
 
   Note: this is not through turbo, so you'll have to build turbo yourself first.
 
+- Updating Integration Tests
+
+  ```

+  pnpm test:interactive -F turborepo-tests-integration
discussion_comments.comment_body:
I think the `-F` flag (can we use `--filter`?) has to go before.  What you have here doesn't work for me from root

```console
~/src/github.com/vercel/turbo$ pnpm test:interactive -F turborepo-tests-integration
 ERR_PNPM_RECURSIVE_EXEC_FIRST_FAIL  Command "test:interactive" not found

Did you mean "pnpm test:integration"?
```

did you mean:

```suggestion
  pnpm --filter turborepo-tests-integration test:interactive
```
